request_0.formal_statement:
lemma factorization_of_quadratic:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n - 2) * (n - 1)"

request_1.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "prime (a * b) \<longleftrightarrow> (a = 1 \<and> b = p) \<or> (a = p \<and> b = 1)"

request_2.formal_statement:
lemma only_even_prime:
  shows "prime p \<Longrightarrow> (p mod 2 = 0) \<Longrightarrow> p = 2"

request_3.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)" "a > 1" "b > 1"
  shows "False"

request_4.formal_statement:
lemma only_even_prime:
  shows "∀p. prime p ⟹ (p = 2 ⟷ (∃n. p = 2 * n))"

request_5.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)" 
  shows "a = 1 ∨ b = 1"

request_6.formal_statement:
lemma consecutive_integers_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "(n - 1) * (n - 2) = n^2 - 3n + 2"

request_7.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_two_integers_is_prime:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "prime (a * b)"
  shows "a = 1 ∨ b = 1"

request_8.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = 2" and "a > 0" and "b > 0"
  shows "a = 1 \<and> b = 2 \<or> a = 2 \<and> b = 1"

request_9.formal_statement:
lemma factor_quadratic:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n-1)*(n-2)"

request_10.formal_statement:
lemma prime_definition:
  fixes p :: nat
  shows "prime p \<longleftrightarrow> (p > 1 \<and> (\<forall>m. m > 1 \<and> m < p \<longrightarrow> p mod m \<noteq> 0))"

request_11.formal_statement:
lemma case_analysis_product_two:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n - 2) * (n - 1) = 2 \<longrightarrow> (n = 3) \<or> (n = 0)"

request_12.formal_statement:
lemma positive_integer_properties:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "n - 1 > 0 \<and> n - 2 >= 0"

request_13.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product_condition:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime ((n - 1) * (n - 2)) \<longleftrightarrow> (n - 1 = 1 \<and> (n - 2) = 0) \<or> (n - 2 = 1 \<and> (n - 1) \text{ is prime})"

request_14.formal_statement:
lemma only_even_prime:
  shows "prime p ⟷ (p = 2 ∨ (p > 2 ∧ odd p))"

request_15.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_integers:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = c" and "c > 0"
  shows "∃x y. (x = a ∧ y = b) ∨ (x = b ∧ y = a)"

request_17.formal_statement:
lemma unique_positive_solution:
  fixes k :: nat
  assumes "k > 0"
  shows "∃! n. (n - 1) * (n - 2) = k ⟷ (n = 3 ∧ k = 2)"

request_18.formal_statement:
lemma product_prime_condition:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)"
  shows "a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_19.formal_statement:
lemma unique_solution_product_two:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "(n - 2) * (n - 1) = 2"
  shows "n = 3"

request_20.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factors:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "prime n"
  shows "n = 2 \<or> n = p" where "p" is a prime greater than 2

request_21.formal_statement:
lemma consecutive_integers_parity:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "even (n - 1) \<or> even (n - 2)"

request_22.formal_statement:
lemma product_equals_prime:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = p" and "prime p"
  shows "a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_23.formal_statement:
lemma factor_quadratic:
  fixes a b c :: real
  assumes "a ≠ 0"
  shows "∃x y. a*x^2 + b*x + c = 0 ⟷ (x - y)(x - z) = 0"

request_24.formal_statement:
lemma unique_solution_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0" "n - 2 > 0" "n - 1 > 0"
  shows "∃!n. (n - 2)(n - 1) = 2"

request_25.formal_statement:
lemma product_prime_condition:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0" "prime (a * b)"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = p ∨ a = p ∧ b = 1" for some prime p

request_26.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even:
  assumes "prime p" and "p mod 2 = 0"
  shows "p = 2"

request_27.formal_statement:
lemma solve_product_eq:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a * b = 2"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = 2 ∨ a = 2 ∧ b = 1"

request_28.formal_statement:
lemma even_odd_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "even a" and "odd b"
  shows "even (a * b)"

request_29.formal_statement:
lemma product_even_odd:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a mod 2 = 0" and "b mod 2 = 1"
  shows "a * b mod 2 = 0"

request_30.formal_statement:
lemma prime_check:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "p > 1"
  shows "prime p \<longleftrightarrow> (\<exists>k. k > 1 \<and> k < p \<and> p mod k = 0)"

request_31.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime (n^2 - 3*n + 2) \<longleftrightarrow> (n = 3)"

request_32.formal_statement:
lemma even_product:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "(a mod 2 = 0) \<or> (b mod 2 = 0) \<Longrightarrow> (a * b mod 2 = 0)"

request_33.formal_statement:
lemma product_even_odd:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "(even a \<and> odd b) \<or> (odd a \<and> even b) \<Longrightarrow> even (a * b)"

request_34.formal_statement:
lemma prime_check:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 1"
  shows "prime n ⟷ (∀d. d dvd n ⟶ d = 1 ∨ d = n)"

request_35.formal_statement:
lemma factor_quadratic:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n - 2) * (n - 1)"
  by (simp add: algebra_simps)

request_36.formal_statement:
lemma is_prime:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "p > 1"
  shows "prime p ⟷ (∀d. d ∣ p ⟶ d = 1 ∨ d = p)"
  by (simp add: prime_def)

request_37.formal_statement:
lemma product_of_factors_is_prime:
  fixes a b :: nat
  assumes "prime (a * b)" "a > 0" "b > 0"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = p ∨ a = p ∧ b = 1"

request_38.formal_statement:
lemma parity_of_factors:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "even (n - 1) \<or> even (n - 2)"

request_39.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  assumes "prime p" "p = a * b"
  shows "a = 1 ∨ a = p ∨ b = 1 ∨ b = p"

request_41.formal_statement:
lemma prime_even_product:
  assumes "prime p" and "p = a * b"
  shows "p = 2 \<or> a = 1 \<or> b = 1"

request_42.formal_statement:
lemma parity_of_consecutive_integers:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "even n ∨ odd n"

request_43.formal_statement:
lemma prime_factorization:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "n^2 - 3*n + 2 = (n-2)*(n-1)"

request_45.formal_statement:
lemma check_prime:
  fixes p :: nat
  assumes "p > 1"
  shows "prime p \<longleftrightarrow> (\<forall>k. k > 1 \<and> k < p \<longrightarrow> p mod k \<noteq> 0)"

request_46.formal_statement:
lemma check_prime:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n = 3"
  shows "prime (n^2 - 3*n + 2)"

request_47.formal_statement:
lemma even_product_consecutive:
  fixes n :: nat
  shows "even (n * (n + 1))"

request_48.formal_statement:
lemma prime_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "prime ((n - 1) * (n - 2)) \<longleftrightarrow> (n - 1) * (n - 2) = 2"

request_49.formal_statement:
lemma consecutive_integers_product:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "n > 0"
  shows "(n-2)*(n-1) = 2 \<longleftrightarrow> n = 3"

request_50.formal_statement:
lemma product_cases:
  fixes n :: nat
  assumes "(n-2)*(n-1) = 2"
  shows "n = 3 ∨ n = 0"

request_51.formal_statement:
lemma even_prime:
  shows "prime p ⟷ (p = 2 ∨ (p > 2 ∧ odd p))"
  by (simp add: prime_def)

request_52.formal_statement:
lemma product_prime:
  assumes "a * b = p" and "prime p"
  shows "a = 1 ∧ b = p ∨ a = p ∧ b = 1"
  by (metis assms prime_def)
